source.title: A report claims left-wing terrorism is rising. The data paints a complicated picture

facts: U.S. flags fly at half staff following the assassination of conservative commentator Charlie Kirk.

The report analyzed roughly 30 years of data and found that between Jan. 1 and July 4, far-left terrorist plots outnumbered those from the right by five to one in incidents coded as such during the first half of 2025.
Five instances were coded as left-wing terrorism for the first six months of 2025 according to Byman and McCabe's study at CSIS.
The single act that was counted by CSIS in right-wing terrorism during this period involved the shooting of Minnesota state senator John Hoffman.

neutral.headline: CSIS Report Analyzes Domestic Terrorism Trends
neutral.body_html: A report from CSIS analyzing domestic terrorism trends in the U.S., based on roughly three decades of data, found a disproportionate number of far-left plots compared to right-wing ones during the first half of 2025.

conservative.headline: Report Suggests Increase in Far-Left Terrorism
conservative.body_html: A recent report from CSIS suggests a significant increase in far-left terrorist activities, with five instances coded as such for the first half of 2025. This comes despite only one act being counted by the study within right-wing extremism during this period.

liberal.headline: CSIS Report Finds Disproportionate Left-Wing Terrorist Activity
liberal.body_html: The CSIS report, analyzing data from the past thirty years and focusing on incidents coded as domestic terrorism between Jan. 1 and July 4 of 2025, indicates a concerning rise in far-left plots compared to right-wing ones during this period.
